homotopy_classification.verdict: ✅ Correct - π₃(SU(2)) = ℤ is established mathematics

scale_identification.verdict: 🔴 NOT JUSTIFIED - f_π ≠ v_χ (different physics sectors)

field_identification.verdict: 🔴 INCONSISTENT - χ: ∂𝒮 → ℂ cannot equal U: ℝ³ → SU(2)

pathologies.verdict: ✅ No pathologies in standard Skyrme physics

physical_issues.description: f_π = 93 MeV (QCD) vs v_χ = 246 GeV (EW) are different scales
physical_issues.impact: Invalidates direct identification of CG χ field with Skyrme U field

physical_issues.description: χ defined as complex scalar ℂ, but Skyrme requires SU(2) matrix field
physical_issues.impact: Cannot apply Skyrme physics to χ without additional structure

physical_issues.description: No derivation showing how SU(3) color field χ_c becomes SU(2) flavor field U

experimental_tensions.tension: Factor of 1000 mismatch if v_χ = 246 GeV
experimental_tensions.resolution: Standard Skyrme uses f_π = 93 MeV, not v = 246 GeV

framework_consistency.reason: Fermion number = topological charge (if U exists)

overall_verdict.justification: Standard Skyrme physics is established and correctly presented. However, the identification of CG's χ field with Skyrme's U field is not justified and inconsistent with other CG theorems.
